#Text=Sentences handed down over Paraguay 's worst fire
#Text=Sunday , February 3 , 2008
#Text=A court in Paraguay has completed its trial over the worst fire disaster the country has ever seen .
#Text=The Ycuá Bolaños supermarket fire in Asunción left 374 dead , 450 others injured and nine missing , presumed dead .
#Text=Store owner Juan Pio Paiva , 64 , received 12 years imprisonment whilst his son Daniel Paiva , 40 , was given 10 years .
#Text=A security guard , Daniel Areco , was given a five-year sentence while three business associates of the Paivas were cleared of any criminal activity .
#Text=2,000 people were in the store when fire broke out on August 1 , 2004 , including many families with young children .
#Text=Fire doors were shut to prevent looting , worsening the situation .
#Text=The investigation found that flames broke out in a badly built chimney because of inadequately maintained equipment .
#Text=A lack of fire escapes , fire detection system and fire suppression system all contributed to the disaster .
#Text=Most of the deaths were caused by asphyxiation due to the smoke .
#Text=The nine missing bodies are believed to have been completely destroyed by the extreme temperature .
#Text=Paiva senior was convicted on the basis that as the owner and chief administrator of the business , including the building , he was responsible for overall safety .
#Text=His son was responsible for the food court area , the site where the blaze started .
#Text=The security guard was convicted for blocking the exits , although he was acting on senior orders .
#Text=The three other businessmen were acquitted as they were not involved in the administration of the store .
#Text=The Paivas were both convicted of manslaughter and exposing people to danger within the workplace .
#Text=Areco was found guilty of negligence .
#Text=The three judge tribunal was headed by German Torres .

#Text=It replaced an earlier trial in 2006 , when the court announced that it was 2-1 in favour of more lenient sentences , but got no further as friends and relatives stormed the courtroom and rioted in the streets outside .
#Text=The court had been going to hand out five-year sentences to the Paivas .
#Text=A peaceful protest was also held at yesterday 's verdict , with demonstrators shouting " Assassins ! Assassins ! " and " This kind of justice is injustice ! "
#Text=Ten women who lost relatives fainted in the heat and were hospitalised .
#Text=The protestors were pressing for those involved to receive the maximum possible sentence of 25 years .
#Text=One , Lys Torres , vowed to use the appeals courts to press for tougher sentences .
#Text=" It s an outrage .

#Text= This shows that in this country , people with money can kill with impunity , " Bersabe Meza , who lost her husband in the fire , said .

column1: #Text=Chief prosecuter Edgar Sanchez , who had also requested maximum sentences , said " My conscience is clear .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Meanwhile , relatives laid out a white plastic chair in the streets for each of those killed , adorned with signs bearing such notices as  If there is no justice , the people will rise up . "

column1: #Text=The ruined store remains standing , graffitied and adorned in tribute to those who died .
